column3: Compilation/Reprint set
Notes

column15: Not all products are always available in all languages. For example, the official website lists products like intro pack, fat packs, and event decks (for example) not being available in all languages.

column3: First White border set
First set with Gift set (wiki); foreign sets black border (ruling first printing in a language is black border); copyright year printed on foreign cards

First Multicolored; wiki implies foreign language was released at a later date and Italian The Dark actually predates Italian Legends, but actual dates were hard to track down: "Legends is the oldest Magic expansion that was released in the Italian language (though the Italian The Dark was released earlier)." couldn't find sources for any claims, but lots of people seem to say italian legends had a larger print run that began months after the English version. First English set with copyright year
Official MTG site says june 1994 release
First expansion with many languages
Arabian Nights, Antiquities, Legends, The Dark reprints, original set symbols white boardered, Official site lists July 1995 as release date
122 cards in French and German and 60 cards in Italian, black border
First simultaneous internation release
Last expansion to use multiple arts on cards to make identification easier as the game was growing in other languages
African themed

Simplified Chinese got a rarity colored V and was released in 1998, official website does not list simplified Chinese but sellers like Star City Games stock them http://www.starcitygames.com/catalog/magic_the_gathering/product/172513 http://www.starcitygames.com/catalog/magic_the_gathering/product/571566/571567
Uses different wording from Magic, simplified version of the game
First set with special pre-release card (appears to only be in English) https://scryfall.com/card/ppre/1/dirtcowl-wurm
First set I bought, First English set with rarity color symbols

First English core set with a symbol

Not released in North America. Made for Asian market. English cards only sold in Australia and New Zealand making English cards very rare. Full set illustrated by Asian artists. Flavor based on Chinese History (second set after Arabian Nights), Three Kingdoms period. References real people (second set after Legends).
No information on the official website, scryfall only has English, but Scryfall does not have a complete catalogue of pictures of older foreign sets.
No information on the official website, scryfall only has English, but Scryfall does not have a complete catalogue of pictures of older foreign sets.

First set where I started to care about the story
Notes
"Legendary" added as a supertype; Japanese mythology and legend themed block.

First set in Russian. All other langauges printed in white border, but Russian in black. Apparently the Russian cards' popularity is part of the reason white borders are no longer used. Russian Shivan Dragon given out for promos instead of the normal Force of Nature. It appears the prerelease Force of Nature might have been in other languages but I can see no photos of them (look more).

"Salvat 2005 is a reprint set only released into the Spanish, French and Italian markets. The cards from the Rats deck were also released in an English version in the UK. The set was distributed in booster packs of twelve cards with (bi-)weekly issues of the collectible Magic Encyclopedia. The cards are white bordered and feature a flying Pegasus as expansion symbol. The cards form ten preconstructed theme decks (12 for the Italian version under the name of Hachette), with the cards of each deck numbered #1 to #60."

"Ravnica" means "plains" in some eastern european language and Eastern Europe archecture is seen throughout the art for the set. http://www.starcitygames.com/magic/misc/24645-Return-To-Ravnica-For-Those-Whove-Never-Been.html
"The name is taken from eponymous Hebrew biblical creatures. Nephilim is derived from the Hebrew ‏נָפַל‎ (singular: nephil), “those who cause others to fall”." https://mtg.gamepedia.com/Nephilim
Official website does not list Russian, although there are Russian cards.
Time shifted cards were printed in all lanugages

Randomly inserted premium cards that didn't have reminder text, some had new flavor text, and alignment was different (Time Stop). These appear to only have been in English. Tokens and marketing cards inserted into packs. (Languages?)
Irish, English, Welsh, Scottish, and Celtic stories, languages and cultures in both the look and world details of the setting. https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/taste-2007-09-13
Notes
Ajani prerelease supposedly in six languages https://mtg.gamepedia.com/Prerelease_card
Premium Foil Boosters (Jan 2010) with cards from every set in block. 15 card backs. All foil. Only English

The packs contained "Priceless Treasures" stock from old sets (Alpha - Antiquities) some of which that were signed.  Not mint condition. Only English (sets only had English printings) but were avaliable in all language packs
Black bordered Spanish only reprint: https://mtg.gamepedia.com/Salvat_2011
Return of Korean being printed

Gothic Horror theme based in US and Western Europe much like Gothic novels of the 18th and 19th Centuries. Multiple locations with "wald" (german for forest) like the Somberwald and the Ulvenwald (which contains Ulven, which appears to be Dannish for Wolf)
Only English but distributed worldwide
